      • getExpression

        public java.lang.String getExpression()
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        For display only. Note that all methods returning strings should not be used for algebraic treatment at all.

        They are used recursively by the getExpression() method from the Expression class, to print the final result of the calculation

        Specified by:
        getExpression in interface Variable
        Returns:
        the literal form of the variable, x or sin(y^2) for instance.

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getFinalExponent

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.Float> getFinalExponent()
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve the global exponent of the variable. If the last overlay is an exponent, and if the last overlay is a number, then returns Optional.of(number). Otherwise, returns an empty optional
        Specified by:
        getFinalExponent in interface Variable
        Returns:
        the global exponent of the variable

      • isFraction

        public boolean isFraction()
        Specified by:
        isFraction in interface Variable
        Returns:
        whether the last overlay of the variable is a fraction or not

      • uncover

        public java.util.List<Monomial> uncover(int amount)
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve a list of monomials corresponding to the variable without a given amount of overlays. If the amount given is exactly the amount of overlays, Variable.getElements() will be returned. If the amount given is lower than the amount of overlays, a single monomial with a 1 coefficient and the variable without the last overlay will be returned. If the amount of given is greater than the amount of overlays, throws an error.
        Specified by:
        uncover in interface Variable
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of overlays to fake remove in order to get the list of monomials.
        Returns:
        a list of monomials corresponding to the actual variable without amount overlays

      • getOverlay

        public ExpressionOverlay getOverlay(int i)
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve the overlay at the given index.

        At least in the implementations provided by the library, negative indexes are supported. Therefore, 0 will give the first element, -1 the last one, -2 the penultimate one, etc.

        Note that the only index supported for SingleCharVariables is -1, being the implicit ^1 exponent.

        Specified by:
        getOverlay in interface Variable
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the list of overlays
        Returns:
        the overlay present at the given index

      • getNumerator

        public java.util.List<Monomial> getNumerator()
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve the numerator of the variable. If the last overlay is not a fraction, then Variable.getElements() will be returned. If it is, uncover(-1) will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getNumerator in interface Variable
        Returns:
        the numerator of the variable

      • getDenominator

        public java.util.List<Monomial> getDenominator()
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve the denominator of the variable. If the last overlay is not a fraction, the implicit 1 divider will be returned. If it is, the elements forming the last overlay will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getDenominator in interface Variable
        Returns:
        the denominator of the variable

      • getOverlaysSize

        public int getOverlaysSize()
        Specified by:
        getOverlaysSize in interface Variable
        Returns:
        how many overlays encapsulate the variable

      • getElementsSize

        public int getElementsSize()
        Specified by:
        getElementsSize in interface Variable
        Returns:
        how many elements are encapsulated in the variable (always 1 for SingleCharVariables).

      • getOverlaysSection

        public java.util.List<ExpressionOverlay> getOverlaysSection(int start,
                                                            int end)
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve a section of the list of overlays, from a given start (included) to a given end (included). Calling this method from a SingleCharVariable will always return an empty list. If you want to retrieve all overlays from a SingleCharVariable including the explicit one, use Variable.getAbsoluteOverlays() instead.
        Specified by:
        getOverlaysSection in interface Variable
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the section wanted
        end - the end of the section wanted
        Returns:
        a list of overlays containing exclusively the overlays with an index included in [start;end]

      • getAbsoluteOverlays

        public java.util.List<ExpressionOverlay> getAbsoluteOverlays()
        Description copied from interface: Variable
        Used to retrieve all the overlays of the variable, including the implicit ^1 exponent.
        Specified by:
        getAbsoluteOverlays in interface Variable
        Returns:
        the list of all overlays encapsulating the current variable.
